perturbation.original_text:
(a) Description. WebMD hereby agrees to provide Emdeon the Content described on Exhibit A in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

(b) License. Subject to Emdeon's compliance with the provisions of this Agreement, Emdeon is hereby authorized and licensed to use the Content by making such Content available to third parties verbatim or as source material via the Software. Such license is a non-exclusive, non-transferrable and worldwide license and shall include the right to use, reproduce, copy and publish the Content solely in connection with the Software. Emdeon may determine the placement and formatting of the Content in the Software, but may not change the substance of the Content to any extent whatsoever without WebMD's written approval of the change.
perturbation.changed_text:
(a) Description. WebMD hereby agrees to provide Emdeon the Content in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

(b) License. Subject to Emdeon's compliance with the provisions of this Agreement, Emdeon is hereby authorized and licensed to use the Content by making such Content available to third parties via the Software. Such license is a non-exclusive, non-transferrable and worldwide license and shall include the right to use, reproduce, copy and publish the Content solely in connection with the Software. Emdeon may determine the placement and formatting of the Content in the Software, but may alter the substance of the Content without WebMD's approval.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to Exhibit A in Section 1(a), but still retaining references to 'Content' elsewhere, the agreement now lacks a clear definition of what constitutes 'Content.' Also removing 'verbatim or as source material' creates uncertainty around what Emdeon is allowed to do with the material. Changing 'may not change' to 'may alter' creates an internal contradiction in the agreement regarding the degree to which Emdeon can modify the content.

perturbation.original_text:
4. Fees and Payment.

-4-

Source: WEBMD HEALTH CORP., S-1/A, 9/8/2005





(a) Payments. In consideration for provision of the Content and all rights granted hereunder, Emdeon hereby agreed to pay WebMD the amounts set forth on Exhibit B of this Agreement. All amounts payable shall be due be due thirty (30) days after the receipt of WebMD's invoice.

(b) Taxes. All payments under the Agreement are exclusive of all federal, state, local and foreign taxes, levies and assessments. Emdeon agrees to bear and be responsible for the payment of all such taxes, levies and assessments imposed on WebMD arising out of this Agreement, excluding any tax based on WebMD's net income. All fees charged hereunder by WebMD are net of any such taxes.

(c) Late payments are subject to an interest charge, at the lower rate of (i) one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month, or (ii) the maximum legal rate.
perturbation.changed_text:
4. Fees and Payment.

(a) Payments. In consideration for provision of the Content and all rights granted hereunder, Emdeon hereby agreed to pay WebMD. All amounts payable shall be due be due thirty (30) days after the receipt of WebMD's invoice.

(b) Taxes. All payments under the Agreement are exclusive of all federal, state, local and foreign taxes, levies and assessments. Emdeon agrees to bear and be responsible for the payment of all such taxes, levies and assessments imposed on WebMD arising out of this Agreement, excluding any tax based on WebMD's net income. All fees charged hereunder by WebMD are net of any such taxes.

(c) Late payments are subject to an interest charge.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to Exhibit B in Section 4(a), but still retaining references to payment for Content, the agreement now lacks a clear definition of what the amounts are. Also removing 'at the lower rate of (i) one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month, or (ii) the maximum legal rate.' creates uncertainty around what the interest rate is for late payments.

perturbation.original_text:
5. Trademark License.

(a) Emdeon is hereby granted a non-exclusive and worldwide right to use WebMD's trademarks and logos ("Marks") for the purpose of identifying the origin of the Content during the term of this Agreement. These Marks may be used by Emdeon, in its sole discretion, in connection with the Content in the Software, and in any form, format, forum, media, medium, means or method by which the Content is delivered. Notwithstanding the foregoing, portions of the Software that contain Content shall include a WebMD Mark in appearance and format mutually agreed to by the parties.
perturbation.changed_text:
5. Trademark License.

(a) Emdeon is hereby granted a non-exclusive and worldwide right to use WebMD's trademarks and logos ("Marks"). These Marks may be used by Emdeon, in its sole discretion, in connection with the Software, and in any form, format, forum, media, medium, means or method by which the Content is delivered. Notwithstanding the foregoing, portions of the Software that contain Content shall include a WebMD Mark.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the sentence "for the purpose of identifying the origin of the Content during the term of this Agreement", it becomes ambiguous why Emdeon is allowed to use the WebMD's trademark. Removing the phrase 'in appearance and format mutually agreed to by the parties' makes the agreement ambigious on how it will look.
